Cell.Data: BEAst: This document describes the BEAst profile, and how BEAst's order messages, version 3.1, for NeC, Rental and Material are linked to the Peppol structure. Peppol: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Peppol: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears. Values to be used are either urn:fdc:peppol.eu:poacc:bis:order_only:3 or urn:fdc:peppol.eu:poacc:bis:ordering:3

BEAst: T3309 and T0034, Order/Calloff number. Peppol: A transaction instance must have an identifier. The identifier enables referencing the transaction for various purposes such as from other transactions that are part of the same process.
Peppol: An identifier of a referenced sales order, issued by the Seller.
BEAst: T3310, order date. Peppol: The date on which the transaction instance was issued.
BEAst: T3310, order time. Peppol: The time assigned by the buyer on which the order was issued.

BEAst: Order Type (T3100). In this version "220" is the only option. The blanket order ("226") is not yet supported by Peppol, so when you mean "226", this element shall be omitted and when you mean "220", the code "220" shall be sent. Peppol: Indicates wether the order is a purchase order or consignement order. Default is purchase order.
Peppol: Free form text applying to the Order. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure.
BEAst: T6018, Currency code. Peppol: The default currency for the order.

BEAst: T6005, Customer's Reference/Number. Peppol: The element is used for the reference of who ordered the products/services. Example being the name of the person ordering, employee number or a code identifying this person or department/group. Also known as "Buyer reference", and should also be sent in the corresponding invoice.
Peppol: Used by the buyer to specify a reference that should be repeated in e.g. invoice to enable the buyer to automatically book e.g. to the right project, or account.
Peppol: The end date for when the order is valid. The end date for the time period within which the seller must respond. An order should contain the validity end date
Peppol: Reference to quotation which is basis for the order
BEAst: T6010, Reference to the offer. Peppol: A requirement to give a unique reference to the quotation that is the base for the order.

BEAst: T6335, Reference to the customer's calloff/order. In the case a calloff/order is sent separately for material and service, the material calloff shall have a reference to the service calloff/order and vice versa. Peppol: Used to reference the initial order that was rejected and a new order is issued.

BEAst: T6221, Reference to the Ultimate customer's order number. Peppol: A reference to Originator Document. To be able to give a reference to the internal requisition on the buyer site on which the order is based.

BEAst: Contains the additional information that is defined by the DocumentType. Used for Package Label (T6368), Notification Channel (T6366), Notification Time (T6367), Notification Address (T6456), Offer GUID (T6485), Drawing number (T6222), Entry code (T6176), Period of validity start (T6400), Period of validity end (T6401), Vehicle attribute value (T6346), Instructions (T6393), Document name (T6484). Peppol: An identifier for the referenced document.

BEAst: Used to specify the type of information sent in ID and in some cases a related code. The format is "BEAST:", followed by the identification about what data is sent, then a ":" followed by the related code. See the example. If no code is used the two last parts are omitted. "BEAST:PackageLabel", "BEAST:NotificationChannel", "BEAST:NotificationTime", "BEAST:NotificationAddress", "BEAST:OfferGUID", "BEAST:DrawingNumber", "BEAST:EntryCode", "BEAST:PeriodOfValidityStart", "BEAST:PeriodOfValidityEnd", "BEAST:VehicleAttribute:" plus the value of the code (T6345), "BEAST:Instructions" (T6393), Document type External (T6473). Peppol: Textual description of the document.

BEAst: Embedded Document Binary Object (T6475). Filename is linked to Embedded Document File Name (T6476). Peppol: The attached document embeded as binary object, coded as Base64. The binary object has two supplementary components: a Mime Code, which specifies the Mime type of the attachment and a Filename that is provided by (or on behalf of) the sender of the document
Peppol: The mime code of the attached document.
Peppol: The file name of the attached document

BEAst: Link to Related Document (T6187) or Instructions URL (T6392) depending on value in DocumentType. Peppol: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.
BEAst: Reference to Agreement or Contract (T0007). Peppol: Positive identification of the reference such as a unique identifier.
BEAst: Project number (T6004). Peppol: The identification of the project the order refers to.
Peppol: Identifies the buyer party's electronic address
Peppol: Scheme identifier for the electronic address
BEAst: T0008 or T6001, the identity of the buyer. Only one identification of the buyer will be used. Peppol: An identification for the buyer party.
Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
BEAst: T5001, Name of the buyer. Peppol: Name of buyer The name of the party who orders the listed items.
Peppol: Postal address of the buyer
BEAst: T5003, Street name/number or Postbox number of the buyer. Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: T5005, City name. Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: T6117, Postal zone. Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for any other additional address information to the buyer. Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: T5007, country code. Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: T0099, VAT identification number. Peppol: The buyers registered Value Added Tax identifier. To be stated in case reverse charge is to apply to the purchase.
Peppol: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.
Peppol: Identifies a company as registered with the company registration scheme.
Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the buyer legal registration identifier.
Buyers legal registration address city name
Peppol: Associates with the registered address of the party within a Corporate Registration Scheme. The name of a city, town, or village.

Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: T5012, Contact person name. Peppol: The name of the contact person.
BEAst: T5010, Telephone number. Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.
BEAst: T5011, email address. Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.
Peppol: Identifies the seller party's electronic address
Peppol: Scheme identifier for the electronic address
BEAst: T0009 or T6001, Identification of the supplier. Only one identification of the seller will be used. Peppol: Identifies a party.
Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
BEAst: T5001, Name of the supplier. Peppol: The trading name of the party.
Peppol: Postal address of the Seller
BEAst: T5003, Street name/number or Postbox of the supplier. Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: T5005, City name. Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: T6117, Postal Zone. Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for all other additional address information. Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: T5007, Country code. Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
Peppol: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.
Peppol: Identifies a company as registered with the company registration scheme.
Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the buyer legal registration identifier.
Sellers legal registration address city name
Peppol: Associates with the registered address of the party within a Corporate Registration Scheme. The name of a city, town, or village.

Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: T5012, Contact name. Peppol: The name of the contact person.
BEAst: T5010, Telephone number. Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.
BEAst: T5011, email address. Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

BEAst: This party is re-defined by BEAst to be the Ship-from Location. In BEAst version 3.1 both the Ship-from Location and the Originator Customer party are used. Between these two BEAst have prioritized the Ship-from Location. Peppol: Information regarding the originator of the order
Peppol: Description of the originator party
BEAst: T0129 or T6001, identification of the Ship-from Location. Only one of the identities will be used. Peppol: Identifies a party.
Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
BEAst: T5001 or T6324/T6325/T6424, Name or coordinates separated with "/". For coordinates use the format WGS84, degrees with decimals. Peppol: The name of the party.
Peppol: The name of the contact person.
Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.
Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.
Peppol: Information regarding the receiver of the invoice based on the order (Invoicee)
Peppol: Description of the invoicee party
Peppol: Identifies the invoicee party's electronic address
Peppol: Scheme identifier for the electronic address
Peppol: Identification of the invoicee party
BEAst: T0085 or T6001, Identity of the Invoicee. Use only one identity on the partner. Peppol: An identifer for the invoicee party.
Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
BEAst: T5001, Name of the Invoicee. Peppol: The name of the party who should be invoiced for the ordered items (invoicee).
Peppol: Postal address of the invoicee
BEAst: T5003, Street name/Number or Postal box of the Invoicee. Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: T5005, City name. Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: T6117, Postal Zone. Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for all other additional address information. Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: T5007, Country code. Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
Peppol: Tax information of the invoicee party
BEAst: T6030, VAT Identification number. Peppol: The invoicees registered Value Added Tax identifier
Peppol: Tax scheme identifier. E.g. "VAT" or "GST"
Peppol: Legal information of the invoicee party
Peppol: The official name of the invoicee party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.
Peppol: Identifies a company as registered with the company registration scheme.
Buyer legal registration identifier identification scheme identifier
Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the buyer legal registration identifier.
Peppol: Associates with the registered address of the party within a Corporate Registration Scheme. The name of a city, town, or village.

Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
Peppol: The name of the contact person.
Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.
Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.
BEAst: T0036 or T6001, Identity of the Consignee. Only one Identity of the party will be used. Peppol: An identifer for the location to where the ordered items should be delivered.
Deliver to location identifier identification scheme identifier
Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the Deliver to location identifier.
BEAst: T5001, Name of the Consignee. Peppol: A name of the location to where the ordered items should be delivered.
BEAst: T5003, Street name/Number or Postal box number of the Consignee. Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: T5005, City name. Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: T6117, Postal zone. Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

BEAst: Used for all other address information. Coordinates (T6321/T6322) are given in format WGS84, degrees with decimals, separated with a "/". Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: T5007, Country code. Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: The Requested Delivery Period should be set at line level, not here. Peppol:
Peppol: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.Format ="YYYY-MM-DD"
Peppol: The time at which this period begins. Format = "hh:mm:ss"
Peppol: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.Format ="YYYY-MM-DD"
Peppol: The time at which this period end. Format = "hh:mm:ss"
Peppol: Identification of the delivery party. The party to whom the goods are delivered
BEAst: T0037 or T6001, Identity of the Delivery party. Use only one identity of this party. Peppol: In this BIS: The identifier of the party that should receive the ordered items
Deliver party registration identifier identification scheme identifier
Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the deliverparty identifier.
BEAst: T5001, Name of the Delivery party. Peppol: In this BIS: The name of the party that should receive the delivery
Peppol: The final address for the delivery
BEAst: T5003, Street name/Number or Postal box no of the Delivery party. Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: T5005, City name. Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: T6117, Postal zone. Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for all other address information. Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: T5007, Country code. Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
Peppol: Contact information for the delivery party
BEAst: T5012, Contact name. Peppol: The name of the contact person.
BEAst: T5010, Telephone number. Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.
BEAst: T5011, email address. Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.
BEAst: Always set to "NA". Peppol: Element is mandated by syntax structure use value NA
BEAst: Shipping Marks Consignment (T0086). Peppol: A text that the buyer requests to be printed on the packing labels.
BEAst: Terms of Delivery NeB (T6710). Peppol: Delivery terms identifier, normally Incoterms
BEAst: Transport Information (T6008) or Unloading Instructions (T6343). Peppol: A description of special conditions relating to the Delivery Terms.
BEAst: Delivery Place Terms (T6020). Peppol: The location to which the delivery terms refer. Used to qualify the delivery terms e.g. "Terms of delivery are FOB Rotterdam"
Peppol: Payment terms for the order described in text
Peppol: Allowances and charges for the order
Peppol: Indicator used to state if the following is an allowance or charge. true = Charge, false = Allowance
Document level allowance or charge reason code

Peppol: The reason for the document level allowance or charge, expressed as a code. For allowances a subset of codelist UNCL5189 is to be used, and for charges codelist UNCL7161 applies. The Document level allowance reason code and the Document level allowance reason shall indicate the same allowance reason

Peppol: A textual reason for the allowance or the charge. Can also be its name. The Document level allowance reason code and the Document level allowance reason shall indicate the same allowance reason
Document level allowance or charge percentage
Peppol: The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the document level allowance base amount, to calculate the document level allowance or charge amount. To state 20%, use value 20.
Peppol: The net amount of the allowance or the charge exluding TAX.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Document level allowance or charge base amount

Peppol: The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the document level allowance or charge percentage, to calculate the document level allowance or charge amount. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Peppol: The TAX category code that applies to the document level allowance or charge.

Peppol: The TAX rate, represented as percentage that applies to the document level allowance or charge. As this element is of data type percentage, please note that no %-sign should be used. To state 25 %, use value 25.00
Peppol: Tax scheme identifier. E.g. “VAT” or “GST”
Peppol: Specification of expected tax amount
Peppol: The total TAX amount that is "added to the document total w/o TAX". This is the sum of all TAX subcategory amounts. The expected Tax Total in the corresponding invoice.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Peppol: Estimated total amounts for the order
Peppol: Sum of line amounts in the document.The total of Line Extension Amounts net of tax and settlement discounts. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Peppol: The "Sum of line amounts" plus "sum of allowances on document level" plus "sum of charges on document level". Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Peppol: The total value including TAX. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Sum of allowances on document level

Peppol: Sum of all allowances on header level in the document. Allowances on line level are included in the line amount and summed up into the "sum of line amounts". Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Sum of charges on document level
Peppol: Sum of all charge on header level in the document. Charges on line level are included in the line amount and summed up into the "sum of line amounts". Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Peppol: Any amounts that have been paid a-priory. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Peppol: The amount to be added to the total to round the amount to be paid. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Peppol: The amount that is expected to be paid. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.

BEAst: Line Item Information (T6031). Peppol: Free-form text applying to the Order Line. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure. Is to capture any free form description related to the order line as a whole.
BEAst: Line number (T0051). Peppol: Identifies the Line Item assigned by the buyer, the identifier must be unique within the order.
BEAst: Ordered Quantity (T0039) and Measure Unit NeB Type (T6706). Peppol: The quantity of Items for the Line Item. The quantity for the order line.
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the ordered quantity.
Peppol: The total amount for the Line Item, including Allowance Charges but net of taxes. The expected line amount excluding TAX but inclusive of other charges, allowances and taxes.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.

BEAst: Indication that BackOrders are Permitted (T6724). BEAst value "160" is here "false" and "161" is here "true". The value "137" cannot in this version be used. Peppol: Indicates if the line items must be delivered in a single shipment. Default is that partial delivery is allowed (true)
BEAst: Project Number (T6004). Peppol: The buyer's accounting information applied to the Line Item, expressed as text.
Peppol: Delivery information for the order line
Peppol: An identifer for the location to where the ordered line item should be delivered.
Deliver to location identifier identification scheme identifier
Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the Deliver to location identifier.
Peppol: Requested delivery period for the order line

BEAst: Delivery Period Start Date (T6319). In this version it is not possible to specify the time (T6734), only date. Peppol: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period. Format ="YYYY-MM-DD"

BEAst: Delivery Period End Date (T6320). In this version it is not possible to specify the time (T6735), only date. Peppol: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.Format ="YYYY-MM-DD"
Peppol: Information regarding the originator of the order line
Peppol: The party who originated Order.
Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
Peppol: The party who originated Order.
Peppol: A group of business terms providing information about allowances or charges applicable to the individual order line.
BEAst: Only Allowances can be used with BEAst version 3.1, not Charges. Peppol: Use “true” when informing about Charges and “false” when informing about Allowances
Line level allowance or charge reason code

BEAst: Special Service Description Code (T6719). Peppol: The reason for the line level allowance or charge, expressed as a code. For allowances a subset of codelist UNCL5189 is to be used, and for charges codelist UNCL7161 applies. The Document level allowance reason code and the Document level allowance reason shall indicate the same allowance reason
Line level allowance or charge reason

BEAst: Special Service Description (T6111). Peppol: The reason for the line level allowance or charge, expressed as text. The Document level allowance reason code and the Document level allowance reason shall indicate the same allowance reason
Line level allowance or charge percentage
BEAst: Percentage (T6228). Peppol: The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the line level allowance base amount, to calculate the line level allowance or charge amount.
Line level allowance or charge amount
BEAst: Amount NeB (T6230). Peppol: The amount of an allowance or a charge, without TAX. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Line level allowance or charge base amount

BEAst: Base Amount (T6229). Peppol: The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the line level allowance or charge percentage, to calculate the line level allowance or charge amount. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.

BEAst: Price Amount (T6235) and the Currency code (T6018). Peppol: The net price of the item including all allowances, charges and taxes but exluding TAX. Although price is an optional element in an order it recommended as best practice to either state the price or provide reference to an appropriate source from which the price can be identified such as a contract, catalogue or a quote.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
BEAst: Price Unit Basis Quantity (T6722). Peppol: The actual quantity to which the price applies.
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the base quantity.
Peppol: Information on discounts connected to the price
Peppol: Only discounts are allowed for the price, hence the only valid value is false (meaning an allowance)
Peppol: Discount amount connected to the price
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
Peppol: The gross price of the item before subtracting discounts. E.g. list price.
Peppol: Currency identifier, value must be the same as what is used in tir01-007, DocumentCurrencyCode.
BEAst: Product Information (T6037). Peppol: Free-form field that can be used to give a text description of the item. A detailed description of the item.
BEAst: Article Description (T6226). Peppol: A short name for an item. A short name given to an item, such as a name from a Catalogue, as distinct from a description.

BEAst: Buyer's Article Number (T6022 or T0172 when T6317 = "BP" or Littera (T6417)). Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the buyer, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the buyer's system.
BEAst: Supplier's Artcle Number (T0172 when T6317 = "SA"). Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the seller, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the seller's system.

BEAst: Global Trade Item Number (T0154) or RSK Article Number Sweden (T6023). All other item number standards used within BEAst can not be used here until the organisation behind the standard decides to be a part of the codelist "ISO 6523 ICD". These are: NOBB Article Number (T6027), RT Article Number (T6460), TUN Article Number (T6028), Finfo/Vilma Article Number (T6029), Norwegian RSK Article Number (T6024), Norwegian E-number (T6026), E-number (T0260) and SGTIN (T6461). Peppol: An item identifier based on a registered scheme. Associates the item with its identification according to a standard system.
Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier
Peppol: Referece to an item specification document
BEAst: Drawing number (T6222). Peppol: Reference to an external document (ID) when it is necessary to specify the details of the item.

BEAst: Used to classify the material when the item number is not sufficient (T6466), to inform about the source of classification standard (T6467) and to provide standard branch codes for the items. The Reference to Article Class (T6466) is the ItemClassificationCode, listID = "ZZZ", listVersionID = BEAST:4.0" and name is Source to Classification (T6467). Peppol: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature. Classification codes are used to allow grouping of similar items for a various purposes e.g. public procurement (CPV), e-Commerce (UNSPSC) etc.
Item classification identifier identification scheme identifier

BEAst: For Item Classification Codes that are found in UNCL7143, select the correct code and leave listVersionID and name empty. For construction specific list that are not a part of UNCL7143 yet ListID must always be "ZZZ" and listVersionID "BEAST:4.0", i.e. mutually agreed. Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier
Item classification identifier version identification scheme identifier
Peppol: The identification scheme version identifier of the Item classification identifier
Clear text name equivalent of classification code

BEAst: If construction specific lists are used, name specifies which of them is used. Possible names are: "SBMI", "SA", "AI", “ME” and "CoClass”. "SBMI" = Sveriges Bergmaterialindustrier, "SA" = Sveriges Åkeriföretag, "AI" = Återvinningsindustrierna, “ME” = Maskinentreprenörerna. Peppol: The textual equivalent of the code value
Peppol: The TAX category code for the item.
Peppol: The TAX percentage rate that applies to the line amount.
Peppol: A group of business terms providing information about properties of the goods and services invoiced.

BEAst: Name of the property or Heading for the BEAst Label. When NameCode is BEAST:Destination 1-8, the name shall contain the corresponding heading (T6347, T6349, T6351, T6353, T6355, T6357, T6359, T6361). Otherwise it is T6469 or T6446. or . Peppol: The name of the property.The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.

BEAst: .Identifies what the Name and Value contain. ListID is always BEAST:4.0. Possible values are: DeliveryUnit, Destination1, Destination2, Destination3, Destination4, Destination5, Destination6, Destination7, Destination8, UnloadingInstruction, ArticlePropertiesNeC + value in T0011, T6444+T6443(ListID). Peppol: Code for the item property according to a property code system.
Peppol: An identifier for the code list used for the Name code, this is bilaterally agreed

BEAst: The content is described by the NameCode. Can be the Delivery Unit (T6340), Destination Content 1-8 (T6348, T6350, T6352, T6354, T6356, T6358, T6360, T6362), Unloading Instruction (T6344), Article Property (T6470), T6452. Peppol: The value of the item property.

BEAst: T6457 (Property Compare Code) + T6706 (Measure Unit NeB Type in unitCode). Peppol: The unit of measure in which the property value is stated, if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity.
BEAst: T6450 (PropertyValueId). Peppol: Standardized and predefined classification of items properties.
Peppol: Information relevant to an item instance or shared by the items in the order line.
BEAst: T3236, (Serial Number). Peppol: An identifier that is specific to the items in the order line.
Peppol: Information about the production lot which the order line items come from.
Peppol: An identifier for the production lot which the order line items come from.
